common_issues.title: Connectivity issues between Pieces OS and clients
common_issues.description: Users reported difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from VS Code in remote docker containers and browser extensions. The issues stemmed from Pieces OS listening only on the loopback interface and port scanning behavior causing console errors. Solutions included patches for Pieces OS and the VS Code extension to enable broader network access and error handling.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points:** * User reports inability to connect to Pieces OS server from VS Code dev container. * The user provides detailed logs and screenshots to illustrate the issue. * The user confirms the issue persists even without any VS Code project open. * The user confirms the issue is specific to remote projects hosted inside docker. **Problems Identified:** * Pieces OS server listens only on the loopback interface by default in version 11.0.0 and above, causing connectivity issues for remote clients. * Host.docker.internal resolution used within the container doesn't work with Pieces OS webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Issue requires a patch to allow listening on all interfaces. * A workaround involving dns name entry is suggested but considered complex. * A patch is implemented in the VSCode plugin version 2.0.1. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Patch released with VSCode plugin version 2.0.1. * User confirms the issue persists and requests further assistance. * A video call is proposed to troubleshoot the remaining problem. **Additional Notes:** * The user is responsive and provides detailed information about the issue. * The problem is acknowledged by Pieces support and actively addressed with a patch. * Communication between the user and Pieces support is ongoing to fully resolve the issue. This summary is based on the details provided in the conversation and highlights the most important information.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Summary: Network request failures in dev console **Key Points:** * User reported seeing multiple network request failures in the dev console, stemming from Pieces OS checking for its active port. * This functionality is expected as Pieces OS port is user-configurable. * The checks only target the Pieces OS endpoint and don't scan the user's machine. * However, the constant error messages clutter the dev console, hindering debugging workflow. **Problems:** * Error messages flood the dev console. * Users find it invasive and inconvenient. **Proposed Solutions:** * Hide or better handle errors from inactive port checks. * Investigate fixing the errors or suppressing them silently. * Offer users the option to hide network messages in the dev console settings. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is identified as a potential Chrome bug. * No definite fix available from Chrome yet. * A temporary workaround is suggested for users to hide network messages. * A fix is expected in the upcoming extension patch update, but its effectiveness is uncertain due to the Chrome bug. **Additional Notes:** * The user appreciates Pieces OS and is willing to overlook the issue during trials but desires a fix for wider adoption. * The developer acknowledges the issue and expresses commitment to finding a solution.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Long-Term Memory Feature Functionality Issue on Linux

### Key Points:

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature is currently in testing on Linux.
* Feature works with X11 but has issues with Wayland.
* Users are experiencing problems activating the LTM feature.
* User has shared logs for troubleshooting.
* Issue might be related to a failing dependency.

### Problems Identified:

* LTM feature doesn't work on Wayland.
* Feature activation button doesn't work as expected.
* Dependency issue affecting LTM functionality.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Suggesting switching to X11 for LTM functionality.
* Analyzing log files for troubleshooting.
* Scheduling live troubleshooting call with user.
* Working on deprecating the failing dependency.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Problem is under investigation.
* User has provided logs for analysis.
* Live troubleshooting call scheduled for Thursday.
* More information about the failing dependency provided in another GitHub issue (link shared).

### Additional Notes:

* This summary focuses on the most important details but doesn't provide every detail in the conversation.

related_issues.title: Obsidian Plugin
related_issues.text:
Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andre-ADPC is experiencing problems with the Pieces for Obsidian plugin.
* bishoy-at-pieces requests console logs from Andre-ADPC for troubleshooting.
* Andre-ADPC is unsure which console to use and asks for clarification.

**Problems Identified:**

* Andre-ADPC is having trouble enabling the Pieces for Obsidian plugin and needs support.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* bishoy-at-pieces suggests using the Obsidian developer console and provides instructions on how to access it.
* bishoy-at-pieces also provides a screenshot of the console for reference.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear if Andre-ADPC has followed the instructions and provided the requested console logs.
* The issue remains open, indicating the problem has not been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The communication between bishoy-at-pieces and Andre-ADPC is polite and helpful.
* The issue conversation provides valuable insight into the challenges users may face when using the Pieces for Obsidian plugin.

Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

PiecesOS 11.0.3

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.

* User (RamanBaig) reports an issue where Pieces cannot access files despite recognizing their names.

* User's system configuration: Windows 11 Home, 24H2, ~9 files in the relevant folder (4 of which are actively used with thousands of lines of code).

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces cannot read files despite recognizing their names.
* Accessibility issue particularly affects files with large amount of code.
* Reproducing the issue has been difficult for developers.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The developers are seeking further details to reproduce the issue. 
* They offer a call with the user for further troubleshooting and testing of potential fixes.

**Current status/outcome:**

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and clients, especially for remote environments and browser extensions.
Address Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature issues urgently, focusing on enabling the feature, ensuring consistent behavior across operating systems, and improving database infrastructure.
Investigate and resolve issues with Pieces OS plugins, including loading failures and file/folder recognition problems. Improve documentation and compatibility information.
Provide clear guidance on LTM usage and best practices to help users understand and utilize the feature effectively.
Analyze console logs and error messages to identify and address the root causes of reported issues, such as the Chrome extension error flooding.
Consider implementing a system for users to easily provide detailed logs and system information when reporting issues to expedite troubleshooting.
Review and update the Pieces OS plugin installation process to provide more helpful error messages and troubleshooting steps for users.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes, documentation, and in-app messaging.
Prioritize resolving issues based on frequency, severity, and impact on user workflows, such as the inability to access files/folders.
